pull.title: doc: remove Fedora libdb4-*-devel install docs
pull.body:
These are no-longer installable on any recent Fedora (last working version was 32). 
Remove the install instructions, and consolidate this section to be the same as the
Ubuntu & Debian BDB install instructions.

events.body:

tree 6025d87e72170ce03a1240f17a2ff38f7632ed1c
parent be443328037162f265cc85d05b1a7665b5f104d2
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1691410311 +0200
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1691412515 +0200

doc: remove Fedora libdb4-*-devel install docs

These are no-longer installable on any recent Fedora (33+).
Remove the install instructions.
Fix the typo in the Ubuntu/Debian instructions.

events.message:
doc: remove Fedora libdb4-*-devel install docs

These are no-longer installable on any recent Fedora (33+).
Remove the install instructions.
Fix the typo in the Ubuntu/Debian instructions.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,14 +111,10 @@ SQLite is required for the descriptor wallet:
 
     sudo dnf install sqlite-devel
 
-Berkeley DB is required for the legacy wallet:
-
-    sudo dnf install libdb4-devel libdb4-cxx-devel
-
-Berkeley DB is only required for the legacy wallet. Newer Fedora releases have only `libdb-devel` and `libdb-cxx-devel` packages, but these will install
comments.body: Not sure about the formatting change and replacing "Fedora" with "Ubuntu". But removing the `dnf install` seems fine.

comments.body: The formatting is the same as the above (hence the typo). Will fixup.

comments.body: This is still wrong. Also, I am not sure why the formatting of a section that is about to be removed needs to change at all. Just leave it as-is?

comments.body: Ok, I see `dnf` actually installs 5.3 and not 5.1. It would be better to mention such changes in the message instead of claiming the section is the "same" as Ubuntu.

-

comments.body:
Nvm my previous comment, it is still wrong. You are changing 5.3 to 5.1 for no reason (not the other way round).

Would be better to just leave the section as-is, unless there is a reason to change something.

-
-Berkeley DB is only required for the legacy wallet. Newer Fedora releases have only `libdb-devel` and `libdb-cxx-devel` packages, but these will install
comments.body: I didn't see an issue with consolidating it to be the same as another identical section. In any case, no more fomatting changes, and fixed the typo in the Ubuntu/Debian section.
